isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Reconditioning - Inspecting Valve Springs

step1.para: Clean all of the valve springs in a suitable solvent.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, do not wire brush or grind valve springs. Disruption of surface may result in fatigue cracks and spring failure.

step1.para: Check the valve springs for rust, cracks, and pitting. Replace any damaged valve springs.
Check both ends of each valve spring at the contact point between the cutoff end of the last coil and the adjacent coil. If the cutoff end has worn a notch in the adjacent coil, replace the spring.

note.para: These wear notches can also be detected by compressing the spring and listening for a clicking sound.

figure.caption: Checking perpendicularity and flatness of valve spring

note.para: Valve springs that are not perpendicular to a flat surface place an unequal lateral load on the valve stem during operation, causing premature valve guide wear.

step1.para: Use a square to check flatness and perpendicularity of spring ends. If the end of any valve spring is not flat and square, replace spring.

Use a spring tester to measure the valve spring tension. Measure the maximum and minimum lengths of the spring at the appropriate test loads (valve closed and valve open). Replace any valve spring that does not meet valve spring specifications.
